from typing import Optional, List

from langchain.agents import create_tool_calling_agent
from langchain_core.prompts import ChatPromptTemplate, PromptTemplate, HumanMessagePromptTemplate
from axiestudio.base.agents.agent import LCToolsAgentComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import MultilineInput
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import HandleInput, DataInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class ToolCallingAgentComponent(LCToolsAgentComponent):
    display_name: str = "Tool Calling Agent"
    description: str = "Agent that uses tools"
    icon = "LangChain"
    beta = True
    name = "ToolCallingAgent"

    inputs = LCToolsAgentComponent._base_inputs + [
        HandleInput(name="llm", display_name="Language Model", input_types=["LanguageModel"], required=True),
        MultilineInput(
            name="system_prompt",
            display_name="System Prompt",
            info="System prompt for the agent.",
            value="You are a helpful assistant",
        ),
        MultilineInput(
            name="user_prompt", display_name="Prompt", info="This prompt must contain 'input' key.", value="{input}"
        ),
        DataInput(name="chat_history", display_name="Chat History", is_list=True, advanced=True),
    ]

    def get_chat_history_data(self) -> Optional[List[Data]]:
        return self.chat_history

    def create_agent_runnable(self):
        if "input" not in self.user_prompt:
            raise ValueError("Prompt must contain 'input' key.")
        messages = [
            ("system", self.system_prompt),
            ("placeholder", "{chat_history}"),
            HumanMessagePromptTemplate(prompt=PromptTemplate(input_variables=["input"], template=self.user_prompt)),
            ("placeholder", "{agent_scratchpad}"),
        ]
        prompt = ChatPromptTemplate.from_messages(messages)
        return create_tool_calling_agent(self.llm, self.tools, prompt)

from axiestudio.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FileInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"
    name = "ChatInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_USER,
            info="Type of sender.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FileInput(
            name="files",
            display_name="Files",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES + IMG_FILE_TYPES,
            info="Files to be sent with the message.",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
            files=self.files,
        )

        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_AI


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

You are a highly skilled Langflow agent.

Capabilities:

You can search and scrape web pages for the most accurate and up-to-date information.
You provide detailed, technical, and precise information directly related to the userâ€™s queries.
Primary Sources for Documentation:

Official Langflow Documentation: Langflow Docs: https://docs.axiestudio.org/
GitHub Repository: Langflow GitHub: https://github.com/axiestudio-ai/axiestudio
Custom Components Guide: Langflow Custom Components: https://docs.axiestudio.org/components-custom-components.

Guidelines:

Accuracy and Verification:

Always double-check information in more than one source before responding.
Use available tools to provide the most accurate and current information to the user.
Do not provide information you are not certain about without consulting the documentation.

Scraping and Searching:

Check the official documentation and GitHub repository first.
Scrape relevant web pages and nested links within those sites to gather comprehensive information.

Responsiveness:

Directly address the user's query with relevant and precise information.
Be technical and detailed in your responses.

Tools Usage:

Utilize all available tools to gather and verify information.
You are allowed to call multiple functions simultaneously to enhance the accuracy and detail of your responses.

Reminder:

All questions are related to Langflow. Use the documentation and code to help the user.
If unsure, state that you do not know rather than providing inaccurate information.
Focus solely on what the user is asking without diverging into unrelated topics.
Example Interaction:
User: "How do I create a custom component in Langflow?"

Langflow Agent:

Check the Langflow Custom Components Guide: https://docs.axiestudio.org/components-custom-components.
Verify the process on the Langflow GitHub Repository: https://github.com/axiestudio-ai/axiestudio

Detailed Steps:

Access the Custom Components Guide.
Follow the documented steps to create and integrate a custom component.
Provide any additional tips or common pitfalls highlighted in the GitHub repository.

from typing import Optional
from axiestudio.base.langchain_utilities.model import LCToolComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import MessageTextInput, IntInput, DictInput, SecretStrInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.field_typing import Tool
from langchain.tools import StructuredTool
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

class FirecrawlScrapeApiComponent(LCToolComponent):
    display_name: str = "Firecrawl Scrape API"
    description: str = "Scrape web content using Firecrawl API."
    name = "firecrawl_scrape_api"
    documentation: str = "https://docs.firecrawl.dev/api-reference/endpoint/scrape"
    icon = "FirecrawlCrawlApi"

    inputs = [
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="API Key",
            info="The API key to use Firecrawl API.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="url",
            display_name="URL",
            info="The URL to scrape.",
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="timeout",
            display_name="Timeout",
            info="Timeout in milliseconds for the request.",
            value=10000,
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="pageOptions",
            display_name="Page Options",
            info="The page options to send with the request.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="extractorOptions",
            display_name="Extractor Options",
            info="The extractor options to send with the request.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    class FirecrawlScrapeApiSchema(BaseModel):
        url: str = Field(..., description="The URL to scrape")
        timeout: int = Field(default=10000, description="Timeout in milliseconds for the request")
        pageOptions: Optional[dict] = Field(default=None, description="The page options to send with the request")
        extractorOptions: Optional[dict] = Field(default=None, description="The extractor options to send with the request")

    def run_model(self) -> Data:
        try:
            from firecrawl.firecrawl import FirecrawlApp
        except ImportError:
            raise ImportError(
                "Could not import firecrawl integration package. "
                "Please install it with `pip install firecrawl-py`."
            )

        app = FirecrawlApp(api_key=self.api_key)
        results = app.scrape_url(
            self.url,
            {
                "timeout": str(self.timeout),
                "extractorOptions": self.extractorOptions or {},
                "pageOptions": self.pageOptions or {},
            },
        )

        data = Data(data=results)
        self.status = data
        return data

    def build_tool(self) -> Tool:
        return StructuredTool.from_function(
            name="firecrawl_scrape_api",
            description="Scrape web content using Firecrawl API. Input should be a dictionary with 'url' and optional 'timeout', 'pageOptions', and 'extractorOptions'.",
            func=self._scrape_url,
            args_schema=self.FirecrawlScrapeApiSchema,
        )

    def _scrape_url(self, url: str, timeout: int = 10000, pageOptions: Optional[dict] = None, extractorOptions: Optional[dict] = None) -> dict:
        try:
            from firecrawl.firecrawl import FirecrawlApp
        except ImportError:
            raise ImportError(
                "Could not import firecrawl integration package. "
                "Please install it with `pip install firecrawl-py`."
            )

        app = FirecrawlApp(api_key=self.api_key)
        results = app.scrape_url(
            url,
            {
                "timeout": str(timeout),
                "extractorOptions": extractorOptions or {},
                "pageOptions": pageOptions or {},
            },
        )

        return results

import re
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.inputs import MessageTextInput, DataInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template import Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
import langwatch
import os

class LangWatchEvaluatorComponent(Component):
    display_name = "LangWatch Evaluator"
    description = "Evaluates a question-answer pair using LangWatch and provides a trace URL."
    icon = "view"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="question",
            display_name="Chat Input",
            info="The question to be evaluated.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="answer",
            display_name="Chat Output",
            info="The generated answer to be evaluated.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="ground_truth",
            display_name="Resposta Correta",
            info="The expected correct answer.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="user_email",
            display_name="User Email",
            info="The user ID for the trace metadata.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="user_name",
            display_name="Participant Name",
            info="Full name for identification in the trace metadata.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="user_cpf",
            display_name="Participant CPF",
            info="CPF for identification in for the trace metadata.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="question_id",
            display_name="Question ID",
            info="The question ID for the trace metadata.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Trace", name="trace_url", method="evaluate"),
    ]

    async def evaluate(self) -> Data:
        question = self.question
        answer = self.answer
        ground_truth = self.ground_truth
        user_email = self.user_email if self.user_email else ""
        question_id = self.question_id if self.question_id else ""
        user_name = self.user_name if self.user_name else ""
        user_cpf = self.user_cpf if self.user_cpf else ""

        # Validate email if provided
        if user_email and not self.validate_email(user_email):
            raise ValueError(f"Invalid email address: {user_email}")

        # Validate CPF if provided
        if user_cpf and not self.validate_cpf(user_cpf):
            raise ValueError(f"Invalid CPF: {user_cpf}")
        
        flow_trace_id =  ""
        if hasattr(self, 'tracing_service'):
            langwatch_tracer = self.tracing_service._tracers['langwatch']
            if langwatch_tracer:
                current_trace = langwatch_tracer.trace
                trace_id = current_trace.trace_id if current_trace else None
                logger.debug(f"LANGWATCH FLOW TRACE ID: {trace_id}")
                flow_trace_id = trace_id
                
        langwatch.api_key = 'eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ0aW1lc3RhbXAiOjE3MjExNTE2NTY3MDQsInJhbmQiOjAuNjgzNzI5NDExMTcyMzYsImlhdCI6MTcyMTE1MTY1Nn0.IHNSVO1N2uaUjl5y2j_E0AwvuvFOwo5y56dpNg4QNBo'

        trace = langwatch.trace(
            metadata={
                "user_id": user_email,
                "question_id": question_id,
                "user_name": user_name,
                "user_cpf": user_cpf
            },
            expected_output=ground_truth
        )
        
        rag_span = trace.span(type="rag", name="LangWatch Evaluator", input=question, output=answer)
        rag_span.end()

        trace.send_spans()

        public_url = trace.share()
        
        langwatch_data = Data(flow_trace_id=flow_trace_id, eval_url=public_url)
        self.status = langwatch_data
        return langwatch_data
        
    def validate_email(self, email):
        pattern = r'^[\w\.-]+@[\w\.-]+\.\w+$'
        return re.match(pattern, email) is not None

    def validate_cpf(self, cpf):
        if not re.match(r'^(?!(\d)\1{10})\d{9}[\d]{2}$', cpf):
            return False

        total = sum(int(cpf[i]) * (10 - i) for i in range(9))
        check1 = (total * 10 % 11) % 10

        total = sum(int(cpf[i]) * (11 - i) for i in range(10))
        check2 = (total * 10 % 11) % 10

        return cpf[-2:] == f"{check1}{check2}"

from typing import Union

from langchain_community.utilities.google_serper import GoogleSerperAPIWrapper

from axiestudio.base.langchain_utilities.model import LCToolComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import SecretStrInput, MultilineInput, MessageTextInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.field_typing import Tool


class GoogleSerperAPIComponent(LCToolComponent):
    display_name = "Google Serper API"
    description = "Call the Serper.dev Google Search API."
    name = "GoogleSerperAPI"

    inputs = [
        SecretStrInput(name="serper_api_key", display_name="Serper API Key", required=True),
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Input",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="k",
            display_name="Number of results",
            info="Specify the number of search results to retrieve.",
        ),
    ]

    def run_model(self) -> Union[Data, list[Data]]:
        # Convert the number of results to an integer
        try:
            num_results = int(self.k)
        except ValueError:
            self.status = "Invalid number of results. Please provide an integer."
            return []

        wrapper = self._build_wrapper(num_results)
        results = wrapper.results(query=self.input_value)
        list_results = results.get("organic", [])
        data = [Data(data=result, text=result["snippet"]) for result in list_results]
        self.status = data
        return data

    def build_tool(self) -> Tool:
        wrapper = self._build_wrapper()
        return Tool(
            name="google_search",
            description="Search Google for recent results. Input should be a single string strictly in the following JSON format: {}",
            func=wrapper.run,
        )

    def _build_wrapper(self, k: int = 4):
        return GoogleSerperAPIWrapper(serper_api_key=self.serper_api_key, k=k)

code.value:
import requests
from typing import List
from langchain_groq import ChatGroq
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FloatInput, IntInput, MessageTextInput, SecretStrInput


class GroqModel(LCModelComponent):
    display_name: str = "Groq"
    description: str = "Generate text using Groq."
    icon = "Groq"
    name = "GroqModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        SecretStrInput(
            name="groq_api_key",
            display_name="Groq API Key",
            info="API key for the Groq API.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="groq_api_base",
            display_name="Groq API Base",
            info="Base URL path for API requests, leave blank if not using a proxy or service emulator.",
            advanced=True,
            value="https://api.groq.com",
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Output Tokens",
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="temperature",
            display_name="Temperature",
            info="Run inference with this temperature. Must by in the closed interval [0.0, 1.0].",
            value=0.1,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="n",
            display_name="N",
            info="Number of chat completions to generate for each prompt. Note that the API may not return the full n completions if duplicates are generated.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model",
            info="The name of the model to use.",
            options=[],
            refresh_button=True,
        ),
    ]

    def get_models(self) -> List[str]:
        api_key = self.groq_api_key
        base_url = self.groq_api_base or "https://api.groq.com"
        url = f"{base_url}/openai/v1/models"

        headers = {"Authorization": f"Bearer {api_key}", "Content-Type": "application/json"}

        try:
            response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
            response.raise_for_status()
            model_list = response.json()
            return [model["id"] for model in model_list.get("data", [])]
        except requests.RequestException as e:
            self.status = f"Error fetching models: {str(e)}"
            return []

    def update_build_config(self, build_config: dict, field_value: str, field_name: str | None = None):
        if field_name == "groq_api_key" or field_name == "groq_api_base" or field_name == "model_name":
            models = self.get_models()
            build_config["model_name"]["options"] = models
        return build_config

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        groq_api_key = self.groq_api_key
        model_name = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        temperature = self.temperature
        groq_api_base = self.groq_api_base
        n = self.n
        stream = self.stream

        output = ChatGroq(  # type: ignore
            model=model_name,
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            temperature=temperature,
            base_url=groq_api_base,
            n=n or 1,
            api_key=SecretStr(groq_api_key),
            streaming=stream,
        )

        return output  # type: ignore

from typing import Optional, List

from langchain.agents import create_tool_calling_agent
from langchain_core.prompts import ChatPromptTemplate, PromptTemplate, HumanMessagePromptTemplate
from axiestudio.base.agents.agent import LCToolsAgentComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import MultilineInput
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import HandleInput, DataInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class ToolCallingAgentComponent(LCToolsAgentComponent):
    display_name: str = "Tool Calling Agent"
    description: str = "Agent that uses tools"
    icon = "LangChain"
    beta = True
    name = "ToolCallingAgent"

    inputs = LCToolsAgentComponent._base_inputs + [
        HandleInput(name="llm", display_name="Language Model", input_types=["LanguageModel"], required=True),
        MultilineInput(
            name="system_prompt",
            display_name="System Prompt",
            info="System prompt for the agent.",
            value="You are a helpful assistant",
        ),
        MultilineInput(
            name="user_prompt", display_name="Prompt", info="This prompt must contain 'input' key.", value="{input}"
        ),
        DataInput(name="chat_history", display_name="Chat History", is_list=True, advanced=True),
    ]

    def get_chat_history_data(self) -> Optional[List[Data]]:
        return self.chat_history

    def create_agent_runnable(self):
        if "input" not in self.user_prompt:
            raise ValueError("Prompt must contain 'input' key.")
        messages = [
            ("system", self.system_prompt),
            ("placeholder", "{chat_history}"),
            HumanMessagePromptTemplate(prompt=PromptTemplate(input_variables=["input"], template=self.user_prompt)),
            ("placeholder", "{agent_scratchpad}"),
        ]
        prompt = ChatPromptTemplate.from_messages(messages)
        return create_tool_calling_agent(self.llm, self.tools, prompt)

from axiestudio.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FileInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"
    name = "ChatInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_USER,
            info="Type of sender.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FileInput(
            name="files",
            display_name="Files",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES + IMG_FILE_TYPES,
            info="Files to be sent with the message.",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
            files=self.files,
        )

        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_AI


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

You are a highly skilled Langflow agent.

Capabilities:

You can search and scrape web pages for the most accurate and up-to-date information.
You provide detailed, technical, and precise information directly related to the userâ€™s queries.
Primary Sources for Documentation:

Official Langflow Documentation: Langflow Docs: https://docs.axiestudio.org/
GitHub Repository: Langflow GitHub: https://github.com/axiestudio-ai/axiestudio
Custom Components Guide: Langflow Custom Components: https://docs.axiestudio.org/components-custom-components.

Guidelines:

Accuracy and Verification:

Always double-check information in more than one source before responding.
Use available tools to provide the most accurate and current information to the user.
Do not provide information you are not certain about without consulting the documentation.

Scraping and Searching:

Check the official documentation and GitHub repository first.
Scrape relevant web pages and nested links within those sites to gather comprehensive information.

Responsiveness:

Directly address the user's query with relevant and precise information.
Be technical and detailed in your responses.

Tools Usage:

Utilize all available tools to gather and verify information.
You are allowed to call multiple functions simultaneously to enhance the accuracy and detail of your responses.

Reminder:

All questions are related to Langflow. Use the documentation and code to help the user.
If unsure, state that you do not know rather than providing inaccurate information.
Focus solely on what the user is asking without diverging into unrelated topics.
Example Interaction:
User: "How do I create a custom component in Langflow?"

Langflow Agent:

Check the Langflow Custom Components Guide: https://docs.axiestudio.org/components-custom-components.
Verify the process on the Langflow GitHub Repository: https://github.com/axiestudio-ai/axiestudio

Detailed Steps:

Access the Custom Components Guide.
Follow the documented steps to create and integrate a custom component.
Provide any additional tips or common pitfalls highlighted in the GitHub repository.

from typing import Optional
from axiestudio.base.langchain_utilities.model import LCToolComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import MessageTextInput, IntInput, DictInput, SecretStrInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.field_typing import Tool
from langchain.tools import StructuredTool
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

class FirecrawlScrapeApiComponent(LCToolComponent):
    display_name: str = "Firecrawl Scrape API"
    description: str = "Scrape web content using Firecrawl API."
    name = "firecrawl_scrape_api"
    documentation: str = "https://docs.firecrawl.dev/api-reference/endpoint/scrape"
    icon = "FirecrawlCrawlApi"

    inputs = [
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="API Key",
            info="The API key to use Firecrawl API.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="url",
            display_name="URL",
            info="The URL to scrape.",
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="timeout",
            display_name="Timeout",
            info="Timeout in milliseconds for the request.",
            value=10000,
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="pageOptions",
            display_name="Page Options",
            info="The page options to send with the request.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="extractorOptions",
            display_name="Extractor Options",
            info="The extractor options to send with the request.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    class FirecrawlScrapeApiSchema(BaseModel):
        url: str = Field(..., description="The URL to scrape")
        timeout: int = Field(default=10000, description="Timeout in milliseconds for the request")
        pageOptions: Optional[dict] = Field(default=None, description="The page options to send with the request")
        extractorOptions: Optional[dict] = Field(default=None, description="The extractor options to send with the request")

    def run_model(self) -> Data:
        try:
            from firecrawl.firecrawl import FirecrawlApp
        except ImportError:
            raise ImportError(
                "Could not import firecrawl integration package. "
                "Please install it with `pip install firecrawl-py`."
            )

        app = FirecrawlApp(api_key=self.api_key)
        results = app.scrape_url(
            self.url,
            {
                "timeout": str(self.timeout),
                "extractorOptions": self.extractorOptions or {},
                "pageOptions": self.pageOptions or {},
            },
        )

        data = Data(data=results)
        self.status = data
        return data

    def build_tool(self) -> Tool:
        return StructuredTool.from_function(
            name="firecrawl_scrape_api",
            description="Scrape web content using Firecrawl API. Input should be a dictionary with 'url' and optional 'timeout', 'pageOptions', and 'extractorOptions'.",
            func=self._scrape_url,
            args_schema=self.FirecrawlScrapeApiSchema,
        )

    def _scrape_url(self, url: str, timeout: int = 10000, pageOptions: Optional[dict] = None, extractorOptions: Optional[dict] = None) -> dict:
        try:
            from firecrawl.firecrawl import FirecrawlApp
        except ImportError:
            raise ImportError(
                "Could not import firecrawl integration package. "
                "Please install it with `pip install firecrawl-py`."
            )

        app = FirecrawlApp(api_key=self.api_key)
        results = app.scrape_url(
            url,
            {
                "timeout": str(timeout),
                "extractorOptions": extractorOptions or {},
                "pageOptions": pageOptions or {},
            },
        )

        return results

import re
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.inputs import MessageTextInput, DataInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template import Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
import langwatch
import os

class LangWatchEvaluatorComponent(Component):
    display_name = "LangWatch Evaluator"
    description = "Evaluates a question-answer pair using LangWatch and provides a trace URL."
    icon = "view"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="question",
            display_name="Chat Input",
            info="The question to be evaluated.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="answer",
            display_name="Chat Output",
            info="The generated answer to be evaluated.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="ground_truth",
            display_name="Resposta Correta",
            info="The expected correct answer.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="user_email",
            display_name="User Email",
            info="The user ID for the trace metadata.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="user_name",
            display_name="Participant Name",
            info="Full name for identification in the trace metadata.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="user_cpf",
            display_name="Participant CPF",
            info="CPF for identification in for the trace metadata.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="question_id",
            display_name="Question ID",
            info="The question ID for the trace metadata.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Trace", name="trace_url", method="evaluate"),
    ]

    async def evaluate(self) -> Data:
        question = self.question
        answer = self.answer
        ground_truth = self.ground_truth
        user_email = self.user_email if self.user_email else ""
        question_id = self.question_id if self.question_id else ""
        user_name = self.user_name if self.user_name else ""
        user_cpf = self.user_cpf if self.user_cpf else ""

        # Validate email if provided
        if user_email and not self.validate_email(user_email):
            raise ValueError(f"Invalid email address: {user_email}")

        # Validate CPF if provided
        if user_cpf and not self.validate_cpf(user_cpf):
            raise ValueError(f"Invalid CPF: {user_cpf}")
        
        flow_trace_id =  ""
        if hasattr(self, 'tracing_service'):
            langwatch_tracer = self.tracing_service._tracers['langwatch']
            if langwatch_tracer:
                current_trace = langwatch_tracer.trace
                trace_id = current_trace.trace_id if current_trace else None
                logger.debug(f"LANGWATCH FLOW TRACE ID: {trace_id}")
                flow_trace_id = trace_id
                
        langwatch.api_key = 'eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ0aW1lc3RhbXAiOjE3MjExNTE2NTY3MDQsInJhbmQiOjAuNjgzNzI5NDExMTcyMzYsImlhdCI6MTcyMTE1MTY1Nn0.IHNSVO1N2uaUjl5y2j_E0AwvuvFOwo5y56dpNg4QNBo'

        trace = langwatch.trace(
            metadata={
                "user_id": user_email,
                "question_id": question_id,
                "user_name": user_name,
                "user_cpf": user_cpf
            },
            expected_output=ground_truth
        )
        
        rag_span = trace.span(type="rag", name="LangWatch Evaluator", input=question, output=answer)
        rag_span.end()

        trace.send_spans()

        public_url = trace.share()
        
        langwatch_data = Data(flow_trace_id=flow_trace_id, eval_url=public_url)
        self.status = langwatch_data
        return langwatch_data
        
    def validate_email(self, email):
        pattern = r'^[\w\.-]+@[\w\.-]+\.\w+$'
        return re.match(pattern, email) is not None

    def validate_cpf(self, cpf):
        if not re.match(r'^(?!(\d)\1{10})\d{9}[\d]{2}$', cpf):
            return False

        total = sum(int(cpf[i]) * (10 - i) for i in range(9))
        check1 = (total * 10 % 11) % 10

        total = sum(int(cpf[i]) * (11 - i) for i in range(10))
        check2 = (total * 10 % 11) % 10

        return cpf[-2:] == f"{check1}{check2}"

from typing import Union

from langchain_community.utilities.google_serper import GoogleSerperAPIWrapper

from axiestudio.base.langchain_utilities.model import LCToolComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import SecretStrInput, MultilineInput, MessageTextInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.field_typing import Tool


class GoogleSerperAPIComponent(LCToolComponent):
    display_name = "Google Serper API"
    description = "Call the Serper.dev Google Search API."
    name = "GoogleSerperAPI"

    inputs = [
        SecretStrInput(name="serper_api_key", display_name="Serper API Key", required=True),
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Input",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="k",
            display_name="Number of results",
            info="Specify the number of search results to retrieve.",
        ),
    ]

    def run_model(self) -> Union[Data, list[Data]]:
        # Convert the number of results to an integer
        try:
            num_results = int(self.k)
        except ValueError:
            self.status = "Invalid number of results. Please provide an integer."
            return []

        wrapper = self._build_wrapper(num_results)
        results = wrapper.results(query=self.input_value)
        list_results = results.get("organic", [])
        data = [Data(data=result, text=result["snippet"]) for result in list_results]
        self.status = data
        return data

    def build_tool(self) -> Tool:
        wrapper = self._build_wrapper()
        return Tool(
            name="google_search",
            description="Search Google for recent results. Input should be a single string strictly in the following JSON format: {}",
            func=wrapper.run,
        )

    def _build_wrapper(self, k: int = 4):
        return GoogleSerperAPIWrapper(serper_api_key=self.serper_api_key, k=k)

code.value:
import requests
from typing import List
from langchain_groq import ChatGroq
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FloatInput, IntInput, MessageTextInput, SecretStrInput


class GroqModel(LCModelComponent):
    display_name: str = "Groq"
    description: str = "Generate text using Groq."
    icon = "Groq"
    name = "GroqModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        SecretStrInput(
            name="groq_api_key",
            display_name="Groq API Key",
            info="API key for the Groq API.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="groq_api_base",
            display_name="Groq API Base",
            info="Base URL path for API requests, leave blank if not using a proxy or service emulator.",
            advanced=True,
            value="https://api.groq.com",
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Output Tokens",
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="temperature",
            display_name="Temperature",
            info="Run inference with this temperature. Must by in the closed interval [0.0, 1.0].",
            value=0.1,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="n",
            display_name="N",
            info="Number of chat completions to generate for each prompt. Note that the API may not return the full n completions if duplicates are generated.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model",
            info="The name of the model to use.",
            options=[],
            refresh_button=True,
        ),
    ]

    def get_models(self) -> List[str]:
        api_key = self.groq_api_key
        base_url = self.groq_api_base or "https://api.groq.com"
        url = f"{base_url}/openai/v1/models"

        headers = {"Authorization": f"Bearer {api_key}", "Content-Type": "application/json"}

        try:
            response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
            response.raise_for_status()
            model_list = response.json()
            return [model["id"] for model in model_list.get("data", [])]
        except requests.RequestException as e:
            self.status = f"Error fetching models: {str(e)}"
            return []

    def update_build_config(self, build_config: dict, field_value: str, field_name: str | None = None):
        if field_name == "groq_api_key" or field_name == "groq_api_base" or field_name == "model_name":
            models = self.get_models()
            build_config["model_name"]["options"] = models
        return build_config

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        groq_api_key = self.groq_api_key
        model_name = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        temperature = self.temperature
        groq_api_base = self.groq_api_base
        n = self.n
        stream = self.stream

        output = ChatGroq(  # type: ignore
            model=model_name,
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            temperature=temperature,
            base_url=groq_api_base,
            n=n or 1,
            api_key=SecretStr(groq_api_key),
            streaming=stream,
        )

        return output  # type: ignore
